name: NPK (15-15-15) fertiliser production | NPK (15-15-15) fertiliser | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23674/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of NPK fertiliser with 15% N, 15% P2O5 and 15% K2O. NPK (15-15-15) is a compound fertiliser used to enrich the soil in nitrogen (N), phosphorous (P) and potassium (K), three of the main macronutrients needed to support plant growth.;In the NPK compound production process, potassium chloride, ammonium nitrate, di ammonium phosphate are mixed to form the NPK compound.;The main data sources for this dataset are Fertilizers Europe (2014, 2016). Additional data sources are listed as follows.;References:;Fertilizers Europe (2000): Best Available Techniques for Pollution Prevention and Control in the European Fertilizer Industry. Booklet No. 1 of 8: Production of Ammonia. Fertilizers Europe, Brussels.;Kongshaug G. (1998): Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions in Fertilizer Production. IFA 20th July 1998;Davies J., Haglund C. (1999): Life Cycle Inventory of Fertiliser Production. SIK-Report No 654 1999. Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden.;Fertilizers Europe (2000): Best Available Techniques for Pollution Prevention and Control in the European Fertilizer Industry. Booklet No. 7 of 8: Production of NPK Fertilizers by the Nitrophosphate Route. Fertilizers Europe, Brussels.;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Carbon Footprint Calculator for Fertilizer Production. Specification. Version 2.1;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Average Emissions Year 2014. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal). Used for updated energy and GHG emission in Carbon Footprint Calculator;Fertilizers Europe (2014): Average Emissions Year 2011. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal).;Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The activity includes all the raw and processed materials necessary to produce this product. Nitric acid, liquid ammonia, potassium chloride, ammonium nitrate,, heat (as natural gas), steam and electricity are included. Direct emissions include ammonia and particulate matter to air and phosphorous to water.

The activity ends with the final product being ready for transportation at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data were collected on fertiliser production for the year 2011. These data were based on annual average data for the year 2011.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset is representative of NPK production in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This datasets corresponds to the technology used in European fertiliser plants. The production of NPK involves the combination of rock phosphate with a large amount of nitric acid, ammonia, potassium chloride, ammonium phosphate, using heat and electricity.
